A treasury department employee faces federal charges for allegedly leaking sensitive government information to a journalist as NPR's Ryan Lucas reports the documents allegedly disclosed were related to suspects in the Russia investigation
Deadly Edward spaces one count of disclosing so called suspicious activity reports and one count of conspiracy to disclose them Edwards worked for the treasury department's financial crimes enforcement network which gave her access to sensitive reports about suspicious banking activity
The government says in court papers at Edwards provided an unnamed journalist copies of these reports about several suspects in special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation including Paul Manafort and Rick Gates
The government said at which took photos of the documents and then ... them to the journalists over in encrypted messaging app both charges against Edwards carry a maximum sentence of five years in prison Ryan Lucas NPR News Washington

Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim hawk the Washington Post has published a final Columbine Jamal ... showed gee the prominent Saudi journalist who disappeared in Turkey Saudi consulate earlier this month NPR's I'm only Sullivan has more
Post received a call I'm from half a percent of the day after his disappearance his editor of ... she'd hoped they'd be able to work on the piece together now she falls that won't happen icon and express the need for journalistic freedom in the Arab world and promoted the opening exchange of ideas and information

A team of researchers is published its first report on hurricane Michael's impact in Florida NPR's Greg Allen reports the information will be used in revising building codes on Florida's panhandle
In a preliminary report a team of civil engineers funded by the national Science Foundation says the high winds and storm surge tested coding construction practices in the panhandle with devastating results to hospitals in Panama City took significant damage tend to air force base had damaged the roost an aircraft hangers and is currently uninhabitable
Many metal frame commercial buildings failed in the storm losing much of their ... glass and siding beeping their interior exposed
Residential damage wasn't confined older homes built before current building codes were adopted the report system newer structures with elevated living spaces and concrete peers were destroyed by the record setting storm surge Greg Allen NPR News
White House counsel Don McGahn has left his post NPR's Scott Horsley reports McGahn was the architect of President Trump's push just shift the federal courts in a more conservative direction
Don McGahn oversaw the president's judicial screening process helping to install dozens of conservative judges on the federal bench culminating with the bruising confirmation of Supreme Court justice Brett Kavanaugh earlier this month
Before coming to the White House began served as Donald Trump's campaign lawyer it was in that role he suggested that Trump publish a list of potential high court nominees to replace the late Justice Antonin Scalia
An unusual political move that helped candidate Trump when the unlikely backing of social conservatives Trump had tweeted about ... impending departure in late August
After New York times reported on the attorneys extensive cooperation with special counsel Robert Mueller Scott Horsley NPR News Washington
An official with the U.S Geological Survey says automated alerts from the new west coast
With the U.S Geological Survey says automated alerts from the new west coast earthquake early warning system are ready to be used broadly by businesses utilities schools and other entities but not for mass public notification
System is designed to give just enough warning to allow time to automatically slow train stop industrial processes
And started back up generators this is NPR News and analysis of ancient rocks in Greenland has found that they do not contain the world's oldest fossils NPR's Nell Greenfieldboyce reports that instead the rocks are almost certainly just rocks
Back in twenty six team a team of researchers said they had discovered cone shaped imprint of early microbial community in rocks from Greenland that are three point seven billion years old
That would have made them the oldest evidence of life ever found now though a different group of scientists has gone to Greenland to take a look
In the journal nature they say the unusual structures were actually created by geologic processes that stretched in squeezed the rock they also analyzed the structures chemistry and again found no sign that microbes created them
The researchers who made the original claim have disputed these findings they still maintain that they had found the world's oldest fossils Nell Greenfieldboyce NPR News
The Los Angeles Dodgers need one more women to get into the world series after beating the Milwaukee Brewers five to two Wednesday evening the defending National League champion Dodgers now own a three games to two advantage and the best of seven series the potentially deciding game sex is friday
Over in the American league championship series the Boston Red Sox beat the Houston Astros ages six late Wednesday in the game that went four and a half hours Boston
Takes a three games to one advantage heading into game five coming up tonight in Houston I'm Jim hawk NPR News in Washington
